page.title: 15Coaley - Village Activities
page.content: Although only a small village, Coaley has clubs and activities for all ages. There is a clinic where a nurse sees new babies and gives injections against Whooping Cough, Measles and Tetanus and vaccination against Polio. The Mother and Toddler group and Playgroup meet each week and are a means by which mothers can talk together while the children play. Girls meet weekly for Brownies where they make things, work for badges and play games. Some ladies meet for the Women's Institute while others meet to play badminton. At the church another group meets to ring bells on Sundays and other special occasions. The church also has a lively choir and a Sunday School. The school is well supported by a group of fund-raising parents.
